subSections.title: Readings
subSections.text:
{{ja-readings
|goon=じゃく
|kanon=せき
|kanyoon=こく, しゃく
|kun=いし-
|nanori=いさ, いす, いわ, し, せっく, と
}}

subSections.title: Compounds
subSections.text:
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|石蓴|あおさ}}: [[sea lettuce]]
* {{ja-r|石%室|いし%むろ}}: a stone [[hut]]
* {{ja-r|懐%石|かい%せき}}: a simple meal eaten before tea is served
* {{ja-r|化%石|か%せき}}: a [[fossil]], fossil [[remains]]; [[petrifaction]], [[fossilisation]]
* {{ja-r|岩石|がんせき}}: [[rock]] (natural mineral [[aggregate]])
* {{ja-r|奇%石|き%せき}}: [[rare]] [[stone]]; [[precious]] [[gem]]
* {{ja-r|輝%石|き%せき}}: (''[[mineralogy]]'') [[pyroxene]], [[augite]]
* {{ja-r|金剛%石|こんごう%せき}}: [[diamond]]
* {{ja-r|歯%石|し%せき}}: [[dental]] [[calculus]] ([[tartar]])
* {{ja-r|硝%石|しょう%せき}}: [[saltpetre]]
* {{ja-r|聖%石|せい%せき}}: a [[holy]] [[stone]], [[rock]] or [[mineral]]
* {{ja-r|石%英|せき%えい}}: [[quartz]]; [[crystal]]
* {{ja-r|石%菖|せき%しょう}}: (''[[flower]]'') [[Japanese]] [[sweet flag]]
* {{ja-r|石%製|せき%せい}}: [[stonen]]
* {{ja-r|石%炭|せき%たん}}: [[coal]]
* {{ja-r|石%板|せき%ばん}}: a [[slate]]
* {{ja-r|石%版|せき%ばん}}: a [[lithograph]]
* {{ja-r|石%盤|せき%ばん}}: a slate
* {{ja-r|石%油|せき%ゆ}}: [[oil]], [[petroleum]]
* {{ja-r|石%灰|せっ%かい}}: [[lime]] ([[mineral]]), [[quicklime]], [[caustic]] lime
* {{ja-r|石%棺|せっ%かん}}: a [[sarcophagus]]; a [[stone]] [[coffin]]
* {{ja-r|胆%石|たん%せき}}: [[gallstones]]
* {{ja-r|宝%石|ほう%せき}}: [[gemstone]]
* {{ja-r|木%石|ぼく%せき}}: (''[[scenery]]'') trees and stones
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|いし}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=いし|-}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Likely cognate with {{m|ja|磯|tr=iso||a pebble; gravel; a rocky beach}}.

subSections.title: Noun
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|こく}}

From {{bor|ja|ltc|sort=こく|-}} {{ltc-l|斛}}.  The {{m|ja|石}} spelling came about through customary use in Japan of this character for the unit of measure.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|こく}}

# [[koku]] (traditional Japanese unit of volume, approx. 180 litres)

subSections.title: Counter
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|せき}}

# alternative form of ''koku'' above: [[seki]] (traditional Japanese unit of volume, approx. 180 litres)
